column4: Column 4
What to Do (Exactly)

column2: Big‑O notation, time & space complexity estimation
column4: Revisit; be able to estimate for your solutions in 30 secs.
Done.You're good here.
Easy → medium bridging; 3–5 problems to warm up from arrays.
CRITICAL.Start here for medium bridging. 5–7 LC mediums on this alone.

column2: Sliding Window pattern(max/min in window, substrings)
column4: CORE.Next after prefix sum; 8–10 LC mediums dedicated to this.
After sliding window; bridges to hash map next.
Use for frequency problems, seen logic; 6–8 mediums.

column2: Monotonic Stack pattern(next greater, temp extremes)
column4: Often surprises candidates; 4–5 medium problems, then skip for now.

column2: Stack & Queue basics (balanced parens, BFS/DFS prep)
column4: Foundational; 3–4 easy-mediums, then link to graph traversal.
Very common medium; 5–7 problems. Practice timing yourself on these.
Reverse, cycle, merge; 3–4 mediums. Not as common in Japan tech interviews.
Prerequisite for trees/graphs; 2–3 simple DFS problems first.
Master all 4; 5–6 mediums, then practice iterative versions too.

column2: Trees – Binary Search Trees (BST logic, LCA)
column4: 3–4 mediums; understand insert/search/delete flow.
6–8 mediums mixing DFS & BFS; critical graph foundation.
3–4 mediums; course schedule style problems.

column2: DP 1D – simple recurrence(climbing stairs, house robber)
column4: MOST IMPORTANT DP.5–7 mediums; focus on "how to form recurrence".

column2: DP 2D – grid problems(unique paths, min path sum)
column4: 4–5 mediums after solidifying 1D.
2–3 mediums; lower priority than grid DP.

column2: Heap / Priority Queue(K‑largest, merge K lists)
column4: 3–4 mediums; very practical, ties into interviews.
3–5 mediums; common in scheduling/booking problems.
Bridges DSA & system design; 2–3 medium problems on this.
Skip for now; lower ROI for Japan interviews.
Skip for now; can pick up if you see it in a problem.
Conceptual understanding enough; skip implementation.

column2: Advanced DP, segment trees, string algos
column4: SKIP completely.
